data.title: Where the cast of original Ghostbusters is now as iconic film turns 40 years old
data.meta_description: Ghostbusters first premiered 40 years ago in 1984 and the world was introduced to the Ghostbusters squad - here's what they've been up to in the past few decades
data.text:
In 1984, the now iconic film Ghostbusters was released and cinema as we knew it was changed.

Not only was the world introduced to the Stay Puft Marshmallow Man, but also the famous phrase: "Who you going to call? Ghostbusters". The Ghostbuster squad made up of Peter Venkman (Bill Murray), Ray Stantz (Dan Aykroyd), and Egon Spengler (Harold Ramis) hit the silver screen for the first time 40 years ago today.

Also a hit was their theme song, Ghostbusters by Ray Parker Jr. Let's take a look at what the stars of the film have been up to for the past 40 years.

Click here to follow the Mirror US on Google News to stay up to date with all the latest news, sport and entertainment stories.

READ MORE: Three women changed Mattel for the better in new 'Black Barbie' Trailer

READ MORE: Zac Efron and Nicole Kidman star in A Family Affair trailer as fans accuse Netflix of copying film

Bill Murray

Bill was already an established funnyman when Ghostbusters premiered, but his stardom only climbed higher afterward. He went on to star in films like What About Bob (1991), Groundhog Day (1993), and Lost in Translation (2003).

For his role in Lost In Translation, Bill was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actor. He's also performed in various Wes Anderson films like Rushmore (1998), The Royal Tenenbaums (2001), and The Grand Budapest. Hotel (2014) to name a few.

He reprised his role as Peter Venkman in Ghostbusters: Afterlife in 2021 and Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire in 2024.

Dan Aykroyd

Saturday Night Live alum Dan Aykroyd went on to star in comedies like Coneheads (1993) and Blues Brothers 2000 (1998). He was also known for playing more serious roles in films like Driving Miss Daisy (1989), My Girl (1991), and Chaplin (1992).

He had a cameo in the 2016 film Ghostbusters, and reprised his role as Raymond Stantz in Ghostbusters: Afterlife in 2021 and Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire in 2024. Outside of acting, he co-founded the House of Blues music venues and Crystal Head Vodka.

Sigourney Weaver

After her role in Ghostbusters, she reprised her other iconic role as Ellen Ripley in Alien 3 (1992) and Alien Resurrection (1997). In 1989 she received two Academy Award nominations - one for Best Actress in Gorillas in the Mist and the other for Best Supporting Actress for Working Girl.

She's also starred in James Cameron's Avatar (2009) and Avatar: The Way of Water (2022). Sigourney also reprised her role as Dana Barrett in Ghostbusters: Afterlife in 2021.

Harold Ramis

After Ghostbusters, Harold went on to appear in films like Groundhog Day (1993), As Good as It Gets (1997), and Knocked Up (2007). He also directed four episodes of the TV show The Office.

Harold contracted autoimmune inflammatory vasculitis in 2010 and later died from the disease in 2014 at the age of 69. The 2016 reboot of Ghostbusters was dedicated to his memory and in 2021's Ghostbusters: Afterlife he appeared in an age-progressed image of the ghost of Egon Spengler.
